mission_data.playerShipNames_arme: RAS Soverignty\RAS Valiant\RAS Independence\ISS Resolution\ISS Undaunted\ISS Necessity\USV Stalker\USV Fearless
mission_data.mission_description: Game Mastered Module for Artemis Galactic Civil War.^^Intended for multiple starships with full crews. Crews may change sectors by changing servers. ^^Includes sandbox items for GM plus pre-scripted mini missions. ^^DB version: Added Base Stations, Black Holes, Modify Objects, Rename Players, some other stuff.

start.gm_instructions: For 50-100 players ^You should have nine/ten servers and 4-12 fully crewed ships.^ ^Set each server for a different geographic sector^ Polaris | Pleiades | Canopus.^ Aquarius | Gemini | Lyra^ Antares | Sirius | Cygnus^ ^TIPS^ If you lose the GM controls, press [SPACEBAR] to restore them.^ Remember, left-click to select a ship or station, right-click to select a location in space.^ Many of the menu commands require you to select an object or location first.^ ^This script was written by Mike Substelny and Darrin Bright, Modified for GCW by Salcor.

big_message.title: PERSISTENT WAR
big_message.subtitle1: BY MIKE SUBSTELNY AND DARRIN BRIGHT
big_message.subtitle2: for Galactic Civil War: Thrawn Strikes Back

event.name: Build_Starhaven_Sector2

set_ship_text.name: Aurora
set_ship_text.hailtext: Virgo Cluster Cruises would like to apologize to our passengers and our dear friends at Starhaven Station that we have to cut our layover short, but we are excited to be moving on to our next port of call. We dearly hope to see you all again sometime in the future!

set_ship_text.name: Ganymede
set_ship_text.hailtext: Yeah, we're not going to stick around for this one... Good luck.

event.incoming_comms_text: MISSION OBJECTIVE: Defend Starhaven Station.^^Long-range sensors have detected a large number of Kralien fleets headed into your sector. There appear to be at least three waves of enemy forces closing in. Although the Starhaven Science Base is a civilian research facility, we can only conclude from the massive Kralien interest that they consider this to be an important military objective. ^^TSN resources are spread too thin over multiple sectors, and unfortunately you're all we can spare at the moment. If you can hold on long enough, we'll see if we can shake loose a supply ship and send it your way.^^Good luck. Aim true.

set_ship_text.name: Transport 1
set_ship_text.desc: An ordinary unarmed transport. It appears to be unmanned and flying on autopilot. It does not respond to hails.

set_ship_text.name: Transport 11
set_ship_text.desc: An unarmed transport. It appears to be unmanned and flying on autopilot. Cargo logs indicate it is carrying a "xenobiological specimen". It does not respond to hails.
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans indicate the biological signatures of Celestius Megalodonis ("Space Shark").

set_ship_text.name: K25
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

set_ship_text.name: K53
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

set_ship_text.name: K55
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

set_ship_text.name: K57
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

set_ship_text.name: K66
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

set_ship_text.name: K68
set_ship_text.scan_desc: Further scans detect unusual electromagnetic pulses broadcasting from this ship. They appear to be targeting one of the civilian bases with an electronic warfare attack.

event.name: Wave3Hack1
event.incoming_comms_text: Something's wrong! The station's computers have gone hayware... the security system locked us out and our systems are shutting down! Our shield generators are failing, and our reactor core is overloading! Maybe a virus? Whatever is hacking our systems, it's coming from those Kraliens! Our sensors aren't working, but yours still are! Scan those Kraliens and see if any of them transmitting anything unusual. Can you take them out before our shields drop?

event.name: Wave3CB1Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: We just lost CB1! Multiple viruses... every time we delete one, six more systems get infected. Probably multiple transmissions, multiple ships. Scan those Kraliens! If you can identify which ships are transmitting and take them out, we might be able to reset our systems!

event.name: Wave3CB2Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: CB2 has been destroyed! Our sensors are still scrambled, but we think we've pinned down at least two of the ships. Before our sensors were bricked, K25 and K53 were generating unusually high-energy electromagnetic pulses. If you haven't already, maybe you could turn them into unusually low-energy scrap metal?

event.name: Wave3CB3Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: CB3 is gone! Multiple ships, multiple frequencies... Scan the Kraliens! We've put together some additional scanner data. In addition to K25 and K53, K55 was also generating unusually high-energy electromagnetic pulses.

event.name: Wave3CB4Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: There goes CB4! I think we've got another target... K57 is generating high-energy pulses, so take that one out quickly! If you haven't already, take out K25, K53, and K55 as well.

event.name: Wave3CB5Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: Well, I guess we can kiss CB5 vaya con bye-bye! I don't want to point out the obvious or anything, but... we're starting to run out of stations. Maybe you should very quickly blow up some more Kraliens? In addition to K25, K53, K55, and K57, K66 was also generating unusually high-energy electromagnetic pulses.

event.name: Wave3CB6Destroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: What? Press which button? This one? Yes! Well... it appears that we are the only remaining station. Based on what happened with the other stations around us, we only have a few minutes left to live. Which of course is truly unfortunate... I mean, can you imagine, all of that research, completely destroyed... you don't suppose, if we started transmitting-- What? Oh, yes! Of course. Uh, yes, we've been able to patch together some of our sensor data, and there's still a lot of garbage in it, but we were able to identify six different sources of high-energy electromagnetic pulses. They were K25, K53, K55, K57, K66, and K68. If any of those ships are still around, then by all means, focus your attention on them. But, as I was saying, the research, if we encrypt-- What! Ow! St--{TRANSMISSION TERMINATED}

event.name: Wave3PandoraLaunch
event.incoming_comms_text: We're clear! Package is in the basket. Rockwell, get us out of this fustercluck! Rendezvous is compromised. Repeat, rendezvous is compromised. We're going dark. Pandora out.

event.name: Wave3HackersDestroyed
event.incoming_comms_text: ust tried that. It's not working! What? Oh, it's working! Hello! Yes, this is Starhaven Station. The hacking has stopped, so it looks like you got all of the Kralien transmitters. So... I suppose 'Congratulations!' is on order...? No, not congratulations? Well, maybe a 'Thank you!'. Unless there are more Kraliens, in which case that might be a bit premature. Are there more Kraliens? Yes? Well then, I suppose you know the best way to deal with them! We're resetting our systems now.^

big_message.title: VICTORY!
big_message.subtitle1: All Kraliens have been defeated! The Starhaven survived!

set_ship_text.desc: A swirling vortex of gravitons, dark matter, and unusual energy fluctations. The strongest life-energy signals appear to be focused on the giant jellyfish-like bodies: J1, J2, J3, J4, J5, and J6.
A swirling vortex of gravitons, dark matter, and unusual energy fluctations. The strongest life-energy signals appear to be focused on the giant jellyfish-like bodies: J1, J2, J3, J4, J5, and J6.
A swirling vortex of gravitons, dark matter, and unusual energy fluctations. The strongest life-energy signals appear to be focused on the giant jellyfish-like bodies: J1, J2, J3, J4, J5, and J6.

event.name: ZulkAlert1
event.incoming_comms_text: According to ancient Kralien legends, these gravitational anomalies appear to be what they call a "Zulkzig". These hostile extra-dimensional creatures like to eat small planetoids. Sensors indicate that their "life energy" is concentrated in the giant jellyfish-like structures: J1, J2, J3, J4, J5, and J6. We suggest you concentrate your fire on the giant jellyfish.

warning_popup_message.message: Gravitational Entity "Zulkzig": Concentrate fire on giant jellyfish structures.

big_message.title: D I S A S T E R
big_message.subtitle1: History books will show your crew was incompetent
big_message.subtitle2: and an embarassment to the uniform.

big_message.title: Mission Failed
big_message.subtitle1: You made a valiant effort but in the end

big_message.title: VICTORY!
big_message.subtitle2: You all receive decorations and commendations.

event.name: Activate_Beacon_Buttons
event.incoming_comms_text: A "Deploy Beacon" button has been added to the COMM station. The COMM OFFICER can use this button to deploy one of your beacons directly behind your ship. This must be done within 1000 km of an enemy base. This will notify TSN Command that an enemy base has been targeted for capture. If Marine Transports are available, they will be deployed and attempt to capture the enemy base. ^^If you do not see a "Deploy Beacon" button on the COMM screen, tell ENGINEERING to set Sensors to 0% power and Sensors Coolant to 8. This will reset the COMM buttons.

warning_popup_message.message: COMM: Use 'Deploy Beacon' button within 1000 km of enemy base to enable capture.

event.warning_popup_message: MISSION OBJECTIVE: Capture all three Torgoth Stations.^^A "Deploy Beacon" button has been added to the COMM station. The COMM OFFICER can use this button to deploy one of your beacons directly behind your ship. This must be done within 2000 meters of an enemy base. If the beacon is close enough, then Troop Transports carrying TSN marines will be deployed in your sector, close with the base, and attempt to capture it. ^^If you do not see a "Deploy Beacon" button on the COMM screen, tell ENGINEERING to set Sensors to 0% power and Sensors Coolant to 8. This will reset the COMM buttons.

warning_popup_message.message: COMM: Use 'Deploy Beacon' button within 1000 km of enemy base to enable capture.
